discourse_list.title: [Open-Discussion] What could be potential reasons for Donut switching from DAI to USDC for their Save program?

content.content: Here is the blog post link detailing their reasons for choosing USDC for this program. Wondering if anyone was involved in this and could provide some key points that might have placed USDC ahead in their program selection.  Was DAI risky and why did you change? No, we plan to use DAI on our upgraded Build and Grow plans. USDC is preferred by our lending partners to ensure safety in the Save offering.
content.GPT-summary: The post is an open discussion about Donut's decision to switch from DAI to USDC for their Save program. The author of the post is asking for key points that might have placed USDC ahead in their program selection and why they changed from DAI. Donut explains that USDC is preferred by their lending partners to ensure safety in the Save offering, but they plan to use DAI on their upgraded Build and Grow plans.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Good find! DAI is allowed in NYS too though. I guess that why I dont really understand the switch. They lend out deposits to earn a yield (and take a spread) to different crypto protocols but I assume that DAI or USDC both can easily be transferred and swapped into those protocols. W/e we will find out in a few years what they were up when they go bankrupt…  Screenshot_20220628-143239_Instagram1079×1079 65.4 KB
